text: We are using calling SDK and trying to customise it's UI and functioning according to our needs

should I worry about that error? because it is only happening in hs project dev -Mode not in production... maybe the hs-CLI limits the payload ...or can this also happen in Production?

Hey Roger, thanks for your reply!
I can confirm the CLI is updated to the latest version.
I'm developing/uploading the project in the actual sandbox account, and I believe it was setup correctly since I've uploaded/developed other projects with ease.
What happens is: if I use the Custom Card while in dev mode, it does not work. However, if I use the same Custom Card (without dev mode) it works.
What does your project setup look like? What are you trying to do? Are you trying to send large payloads to serverless functions

I send from the serverless fuction a large payload to the frontend-card and there I send the large payload to an component I declared in an extra folder and show this large payload to the user in an table object... maybe it would be better to fetch the data tablepage by tablepage... but at first I would like to leave it as it is ...I just was worried if it could be a problem, if it's to large

I think I would need more information about your local configuration and portal IDs you are using if you are comfortable sharing over DM. It also sounds like the issue could be related to running serverless functions locally. You should follow these instructions from our documentation site to make those work locally if they have already been added to your portals with `hs secrets add`

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/serverless-functions>
yeah the functions are limited in the payload capacity, so I assume this is the issue you're running into
I personally page everything for the most part
Okay good to know :) thanks again :see_no_evil:

Ok, I've been trying things for the last 30 minutes but can't figure this out.
Whenever I run `hs project dev` I can't get anything to work in the prod portal (can confirm that I'm running the commands in prod), the extension is compiling totally fine, super bare bones extension. Upload is working great, and dev is working on other extensions in other accounts

Things I've already tried:
1. Reinstalling ui-extensions npm
2. updating the cli.
It does appear that when the dev command is running the port is being used to serve the extension, but reloading and saving the .jsx files don't seem to start dev mode in HubSpot
Creating a sandbox and running dev there also didn't work
spinning up a brand new card with the getting started template also didn't fix this
<@U04EJHVD8FM> I know this is a really strange one, but do you possibly have any ideas? Anything I should test?
can you check your network tab for requests to localhost and see if they're 404ing?
any chance you're running two processes at once?

We make calls to the dev server and it returns us a list of `extensions`. If the appId/appName of the extension you selected corresponds to an extension on the page we swap to local dev mode. So either there is an issue with that request and something isn't being returned, or there is a mismatch between what portal you're loading and the portal you're running the dev server on.
don't even see a network request
any errors in console?
but the account that I start the dev start from is the same account
is that portal in the beta?
These are on other pages as well
yep
I have the card in my tab, hs project upload updates it totally fine

Trying to close a panel ui component in a crm card and running into a weird one.
If I close the panel manually at any time (by clicking the top right x) no error occurs and the button to re-open the panel appears.
If I close the panel using reactions.closePanel.., or if I target the panel close button within the document an error is displayed to the user instead of the button to re-open the panel. This does not seem to trigger any error log within the project however.
Is there a specific way a panel should be closed? I couldn't seem to find documentation on panel reactions so the above were my best guess so far.
I did run hs accounts use so I haven't been doing --account= would that have any affect?
yeah that'll target the account you want to run it on
yeah of course, but if you set the account with `hs accounts use` you don't have to use `--account=` for the subsequent requests
correct!
portal id matches
can you refresh the page again and make sure nothing is going to localhost?
if that request isn't being sent that means theres a permissions issue usually related to not being in the beta or something else.
yeah still not being sent
but since you're seeing the cards it means you're in the beta :thinkonk:
any firewall stuff?
Nope, I disabled all the extensions
did anything change since the last time you ran stuff?
well this is a brand new portal and a brand new card, all the other portals and cards work fine still
have you done hs auth in the cli for that portal
yes of course
hmmm
super strange, right?
I've gotta run to an appointment + will be offline until Monday. I'd double + triple check all auth stuff + try to find out why those localhost calls aren't getting run.
OH
cool cool, will do! Appreciate your help man
are you super admin?
great catch, I'm not
boom
that should fix it :fingerscrossed:
done deal, little strange that I could do everything else but run dev mode not being a super admin
I'll definitely keep that in mind
If anything you should at least see those localhost requests going now
have a good weekend!
you as well!
:thankyou:
